cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north through the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then forecast to turn northeast across the southeastern U.S. and move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warnings limited to Pinar del Río & Isle of Youth (Cuba) and coast of Mexico from Tulum to Cabo Catoche, including Cozumel
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Cuba Pinar del Río/Isle of Youth and Tulum-Cabo Catoche coast of Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Gulf Coast, then inland across the Southeast, Mid-Atlantic and offshore New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; likely gusts 20–30 mph as system passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge 1–2 ft possible along the New Jersey shore
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain, generally 1–3 inches, possible late Thu–Fri
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and short-fuse gales in offshore shipping lanes could disrupt pilotage and container-vessel schedules.
